result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Steven W Gothard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt:
1:14 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by DA - withdraws the motion to revoke and requests dismissal.  Court so orders.

Court adjourned at 1:15 p.m.
Status hearing on June 12, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

1:48 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - has received a copy of the motion to revoke and disagrees with it and states reasons.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.  Court questions DA.  Statement by DA.  Court adjourns for 30 days, defendant to make sure everything is completed and proof submitted to the DA's office.  Court sets for Status Hearing on June 12, 2018 at 1:00 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 1:52 p.m.
Motion hearing on May 15, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
to Revoke the Plea Diversion Agreement

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Terminated - Early, effective January 4, 2017
for Early Discharge from Probation Pursuant to 973.09(3)(d)
Plea Diversion Agreement

2:56 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Charles Giesen.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Giesen - defendant will plea to all 3 counts and enter into plea diversion agreement on count 1 and requests the court find the defendant guilty to counts 2 & 3 under 961.47.  Defendant will also plea to the OWI 1st offense and the refusal is to be dismissed.  State concurs.  Atty Giesen concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to count 1 and GUILTY to counts 2 & 3.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds the defendant guilty on the OWI-1st offense 2015TR1258.  Court orders 2015TR1440 be dismissed.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Giesen.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2015TR1258

-$150 forfeiture plus court costs - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-DL revocation for 6 months
-AODA

Statement by the Court in regards to jail time or will allow the defendant to withdraw his plea - court will take a short recess.

Court adjourned at 3:14 p.m.
Court reconvened at 3:32 p.m.  - Same appearances.

Statement by Atty Giesen - defendant will proceed.  Defendant concurs.  Statement by the Court.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant Guilty on count 1, 2 & 3.  Court will not enter a Judgment of conviction on count 1 pending compliance with the PDA.  Court orders judgment of conviction be entered on counts 2 & 3.  Sentencing argument by Atty Giesen.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2015CF94 (Counts 2 & 3)

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 18 months.

CONDITIONS (EACH):

-AODA
-Drug testing - minimum of one time per month
-40 hours CS - each count
-$250 fine plus court costs - each count
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 3:48 p.m.
State's
Plea hearing at 02-08-2016 02:30 pm
State's
Status hearing at 12-21-2015 08:30 am

9:36 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Charles Giesen.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Giesen - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Giesen and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Giesen and defendant stand mute.  Court enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for Status Hearing on December 21, 2015 at 8:30 a.m. 

Court adjourned at 9:39 a.m.
and Motion for Discovery
By Atty Charles W. Giesen
Status hearing at 11-09-2015 09:00 am

9:01 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Charles Giesen.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Giesen confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading, stands mure to the misdemeanors.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation - bond to continue $500.00 signature bond.  Court orders bond to continue.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on November 9, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.  OWI - initial appearance on 10/20 and requests matters track together.

Court adjourned at 9:03 a.m.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**

1:19 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause.  Court questions defendant regarding address and employment.  ADA makes bond recommendation.  Court orders bond of $1,000.00 signature bond.  Initial Appearance on September 22, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant does not qualify for PD representation.

Court adjourned at 1:22 p.m.
